text: Ursula Pollack (born October 27, 1919) is a German freestyle swimmer who competed in the 1936 Summer Olympics. She was born in Berlin. In 1936 she was a member of the German relay team that won the silver medal in the 4 × 100 metre freestyle relay event. Pollack swam in the semi-final and helped the team to qualify for the final. She did not compete in the final, and was not therefore awarded a medal. ==External links== *Ursula Pollack's profile at Sports Reference.com Category:1919 births Category:Possibly living people Category:Sportspeople from Berlin Category:German female swimmers Category:Olympic swimmers of Germany Category:Swimmers at the 1936 Summer Olympics
title: Ursula Pollack
